html: Those of Jehovah’s people who ought to be valiant and champions in matters of the spirit and intellect or in the defense of their land instead suffer from addictions. The terms “wine” and “liquor” form word link to the opulent of Jehovah’s people being overcome with “wine” (Isaiah 28:1) and to their prophets laboring under a “wine” of delusion: “These too have indulged in wine and are giddy with strong drink: priests and prophets have gone astray through liquor. They are intoxicated with wine and stagger because of strong drink; they err as seers, they blunder in their decisions” (Isaiah 28:7).
